messageBody:
The thing to think about is, with what is the class "really"
collaborating. If a class requires to dump something to standard out,
you might think about the following pattern.

class Foz {

public Foz (..., PrintStream out) {
// link in collaborators but do no work.
}

public void methodThatDoesWork() {
// do the work.
}

public static final void main(String[] args) {
Foz theFoz = new Foz(..., System.out);
theFoz.methodThatDoesWork();
}

}

As you can see, this leads to much more testable code. You now can,
in your tests, insert your own PrintStream that records all the
output. The parse and verify as needed. It also cleans up the test
output, which should not be polluted with stray System.out calls.

Hope I helped,

Big Mike

P.S. I learned this from http://misko.hevery.com/code-reviewers-guide/
